TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content:
About a week into the game, performed my first successful orbital rendezvous today. Yesterday I tried for hours to RV with a stranded Kerbal fruitlessly, then I discovered it might be due to his 8,800,000m Ap and 90,000m Pe orbit lol. Today started anew with a circular 200,000m orbit, pretty proud of performing my first docking and RV with two relatively large craft. I play pure vanilla.

My first Eve expedition ship that will send a probe down and return home.

In case this ship doesn't look like it's able to get to Eve (without landing) and back to Kerbin with full fuel tanks and seven poodle engines, now is the time to tell me.

Fuel tanker taking off.

Docking & refueling

Edited December 27, 2014 by ROXunreal
Made some gigantic probe cores.

Also, what the HECK is a 'brazillian km'? How many 'brazillian' kilometers to a metric kilometer?

Finally, he composed himself and nervously asked Rumsfeld to explain Ã¢â‚¬Å“How many is a brazillion?Ã¢â‚¬ÂÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.
Like a normal kilometer but trimmed I suppose.

Actually I like this answer better.

Made some gigantic probe cores.

They need to light up & make the "dum dum dum DUMMMMMMMMMMM" sound!

They need to light up & make the "dum dum dum DUMMMMMMMMMMM" sound!

And should destroy your ship too close to Jool
I completed a contract to build a new orbital station around the Mun.

While nothing like some of the others, creating ships to conquer the entire solar system and such, I've been making progress, slowly. I began my custom career mode two nights ago. (10% rewards, 1000% penalties, no starting cash, -1000 starting reputation, and running Remote Tech) Today I finished maxing out the starting tech tree (everything under 100 science), established a relay network of 3 satellites around both the Mun and Minmus, put several temperature scan satellites around the Mun, went positive on my reputation, upgraded "Mission Control", and haven't killed a Kerbal yet. Nothing major, but I'm happy to be making progress.

Bill, Dunfurt and Samdock have arrived at Duna.

(Yes, I know I said it was Bob not Bill in the original post. It turns out they look pretty similar).

Used mechjeb to rendezvous with a shuttle. I tried rendezvous a bunch and failed so I'll leave that to the expert(s). So, I did my first docking today docking snacks storage and more kerbals inside the MK3 plane parts and refueled the spaceplane.

Sent some extra oxygen to my Tylo ship, I'd undersupplied it. Launched shortly after the Tylo ship had left Kerbin's SOI and caught it about 20 days later. Wasn't too hard to make the rendezvous, I guess I've had lots of practice with asteroids.

Now maybe before the end of this year I'll land the thing.

Used mechjeb to rendezvous with a shuttle. I tried rendezvous a bunch and failed so I'll leave that to the expert(s). So, I did my first docking today docking snacks storage and more kerbals inside the MK3 plane parts and refueled the spaceplane.

Theres a bit of a trick to efficient rendezvous with MechJeb. First, you want to be in a higher or lower orbit than your target, 25-50km difference is usually sufficient. First set up a Hohmann transfer, do that burn, then do a "fine tune closest approach," and finally "match velocities" at closest approach. Should get you within a couple hundred meters.

On twitch again

Javascript is disabled. View full album
i got a lot done - the Navy's got new toys from Santa.
Well, I attempted to launch my Venus IV rocket, but even my GTX 765M 2GB GDDR5 couldn't handle the sheer shize of it.

Rebuilt Das's Mk3 Penguin from ground up for perfection. Result a full size spine, added and repositioned ASAS, more fuel and battery capacity, minor cosmetic difference, more symmetry and struts, booster packs design retained, RCS system and landing module still under decision.

Test flight reached 100k LKO with 90t worth of cargo fuel. Using it to shoot back down to KSC annd.... missed.

This: http://s1378.photobucket.com/user/craigmotbey/Kerbal/Spaceplane%20economics/story

Alternate format http://s1378.photobucket.com/user/craigmotbey/slideshow/Kerbal/Spaceplane%20economics
@ Kamuchi - Thats golden mate - Best looking ship I seen in ages. Though was expecting a Kerbal to start wacking it to see if it was filled with lollies or such

I continued my career mode Duna mission and landed on Duna and Ike. The payoff feels very high for such a simple mission, but maybe the prices of the tier-3 buildings justify such rewards.

The buffed Mark 55 is quite convenient as a lander engine. I think I'm going to use it more in the future.

I kind of expected to see the kerbals crushed by a rolling Duna.

I tried to get my Glada to actually bring a payload up into orbit, not very successfully, but it now has double the battery capacity and a barometer too, but at least its a lot more stable during ascent, so safer to use at least. Now to land then, hopefully closer to KSC this time.

http://jltsiren.kapsi.fi/ksp/0.90/duna_mission_4.jpeg

I kind of expected to see the kerbals crushed by a rolling Duna.

Duna bowling?
Indiana Kerman and the Boosters of the Lost Stage.

2 Mun landings that bring remotetech satellites with it, 3 comsat's and 1 mapsat.

Here you can see the first landing after both lander's got to mun orbit and deployed sattellite's.

Edited December 28, 2014 by Kotijuusto

Finished mapping Moho last night. Yay. Now, onward to Jool and its moons.

As a side note, I noticed an interesting bright spot on Moho's north pole. It made for easy alignment of the polar orbit. There is also one on the south pole.

Doing an Eve rescue mission for 4 Kerbals stranded on the surface:

Should have enough to get into orbit.. hopefully..

As a side note, I noticed an interesting bright spot on Moho's north pole. It made for easy alignment of the polar orbit. There is also one on the south pole.

http://i.imgur.com/vYKYdwW.png

The white spot is the Moho-hole, should try to land in it LOL
